channel.title: Report Command?1!?!?!?!?!?!?!
channel.description:
Hey guys =) Is there a way to make report abuse work? and if it doesn't, does someone know a way members could type something like: "::report player1 (reason)" then it could go to like some log I would make? EDIT: I just found out I don't have a chat log either.. does anyone know how to make one? or where it would be incase I'm just missing it..
Hehe thanks for your help ;)

item.title: Report Command?1!?!?!?!?!?!?!
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

I’ve quickly typed this up in an IDE for you, since I needed to implement some sort of reporting system as well.

It sorts out report files by the date that the report is given on. All reports from one day will be put into the same file; these files will be sorted into the “data/reports/” directory.

Usage:

writeReportToFile(PLAYER NAME, NAME TO REPORT, REASON OF REPORT);

Example Line output in the file:

[13:20:12]: Primadude: Reporting RandomName; Reason: Spamming.

[code=java]import java.io.BufferedWriter;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileWriter;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.text.DateFormat;
import java.text.SimpleDateFormat;
import java.util.Date;

/**

  • Writes a report to a file.

  • @author Primadude.
    */
    public class Report {

    private static BufferedWriter writer;
    private static DateFormat dateFormat = new SimpleDateFormat(“dd-MM-yyyy”);
    private static DateFormat timeFormat = new SimpleDateFormat(“HH:mm:ss”);

    /**

    • Gets the date.
    • @return The dateFormat variable.
      */
      public static String getDate() {
      return dateFormat.format(new Date());
      }

    /**

    • Gets the time.
    • @return The timeFormat variable.
      */
      public static String getTime() {
      return timeFormat.format(new Date());
      }

    /**

    • Checks if the specified directory exists. If it doesn’t,
    • the directory will be created.
    • @param file The directory that will be checked.
      */
      private static void checkIfDirectoryExists(File file) {
      if (!file.isDirectory()) {
      file.mkdir();
      }
      }

    /**

    • Writes a report to the report file.
    • @param playerName The name of the player who is reporting.
    • @param reportedName The name of the player who is being reported.
      */
      public static void writeReportToFile(String playerName, String reportedName, String reason) {
      String directory = “data/reports/”;
      String fileName = “”+ directory +""+ getDate() +".txt";
      try {
      checkIfDirectoryExists(new File(directory));
      writer = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(fileName, true));
      writer.write("["+ getTime() +"]: “+ playerName +” Reporting “+ reportedName +”; Reason:"+ reason);
      writer.newLine();
      writer.close();
      } catch(IOException ioException) {
      System.out.println(“Exception thrown whilst writing report data:”);
      ioException.printStackTrace();
      }
      }
      }[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Report Command?1!?!?!?!?!?!?!
item.dc:creator: @noobie22 Noobie22
item.description:
@noobie22 wrote:

yeah actually. make your log file name, do it yourself rather easy. its like a mute command.

[code]if(playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“report”)) {
String reported = playerCommand.substring(7); // dont change the 7

try {
playerHandler.messageToAll(“A player has been reported!”); //lets people know someones been reported
sendMessage("You have reported +reported+); // tells the player who they reported
writeLog(+reported+, reports); //writes the reported name
}
}[/code]

I think it’s something like that.
